channel.title: Suggest-a-rule topic
channel.description: Be it from removal of "obfuscated clients" or removal of a specific word/phrase, suggest it here and it will be considered.

item.description:

Forum Admins - ACTIVE / SOMEWHAT ACTIVE MEMBERS
Forum GMods - RECENTLY JOINED / NOT YET ACTIVE MEMBERS
Server Admins - INACTIVE MEMBERS
Server Mods - Final notes
Funny - Serious[/quote]
Big difference lolz[/quote]
Yes but the fact is most of the members of that team are actually contributing to that project everyday, everytime i go into that channel i see them working on a new part of the server, so its far from a dud project.
@Taharok, less strict than the already inactive moparscape moderating team?

item.title: Suggest-a-rule topic
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“ThugLife, post:39, topic:164451”]You are parents of this forum, your job is to look after the forum. Having useless topics for the heck of seeing who will be their forum mods, admins, server admins/programmers on an smfforfree site is completely fucking stupid.
Either sort it out, or maybe a few of us on irc will get together and start making our own “development teams” that last a day, then make another and keep on going.
Because most people who make these ‘teams’ do not stick to just one, nooo they decide they got bored on their old team that did nothing anyway and decided to make another.

I do not see how you can let “development topics” go when on the topic it is just telling the reader what positions on the forum are open, arnt development teams.
I mean c’mon, i would not of complained if they even had a slightest deal on what they were actually doing, but most of them have a simple:

Hi i am making a new server called ImAFuckingIdiotScape forums will be here: http://ImAFuckingIdiotScape.smfforfree4.com.

Positions open:
admin
mod
…

You get me…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 27, 2007, 06:03:39 AM[/size][hr]Compare:
http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,226926.0.html

http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,218763.0.html
Spot the difference(s).[/quote]

In all honesty, you are completely right in saying that we are parents of the forums, but we should not have to baby every single person on this forum. No, people should have their own choice for their topics. Why should we have strict rules which just cause people to break more rules? If we were less strict then there would be less rule breakers and more development.

Read full topic

Because most people who make these ‘teams’ do not stick to just one, nooo they decide they got bored on their old team that did nothing anyway and decided to make another.

I do not see how you can let “development topics” go when on the topic it is just telling the reader what positions on the forum are open, arnt development teams.
I mean c’mon, i would not of complained if they even had a slightest deal on what they were actually doing, but most of them have a simple:

Hi i am making a new server called ImAFuckingIdiotScape forums will be here: http://ImAFuckingIdiotScape.smfforfree4.com.

Positions open:

You get me…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 27, 2007, 06:03:39 AM[/size][hr]Compare:

item.title: Suggest-a-rule topic
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:36, topic:164451”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=223295.msg1955017#msg1955017 date=1198724587]

Personally I believe that if a so called development topic even makes mention of positions such as “forum mod”, “forum admin”, and so on, then it should be removed immediately.
However, it is important to not let on that the topic has been removed because people are referencing such positions, because then people will simply find other ways to mention it (through the pm system, perhaps) without it being seen by us.

Such topics are no more then an attempt at recruiting users for other forums, with the lure tactic being to offer them some sort of position with power.

If it was a real topic for development then it would undoubtedly have some sort of reverence to subversion. The creator would also be someone that is known in the community, instead of someone who has shown up the day before. Little, if any, emphasis would be on an external forum, simply because subversion and msn or IRC would be the home of the source and developers respectively.

But not all of them are. Another thing, locking topics that do not directly break the rules is an act of power abuse. I do not care what excuse the moderator who locked it gives, but they are still power abusing unless a rule against the topic previously exist. The moderator team is very biased and inconsistent.
[/quote]
Name one “development team” that put loads of emphasis on forum staffing positions that developed something. Or at least name one that lasted for a month and half developed something.

It’s no secret that those development team topics are usually used to get people to go to www.shittysubdomainhere.smfforfree.com.[/quote]

Well whether the fact they have lasted just a month and a half is irrelevant to whether to try to pull people to their forums. I have seen a few that did not base their topic around their forums when we told people they were allowed to have development teams, but now that is basically all that they are doing. These people realize that they can take our rules literally and, instead of posting the link for their forums, they just give every last detail about it to have the same effect. But, in my opinion and in all honesty, who the hell cares about what they have in their topic. We are moderators, not parents.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggest-a-rule topic

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Lothy:

It’s no secret that those development team topics are usually used to get people to go to www.shittysubdomainhere.smfforfree.com.

However, it is important to not let on that the topic has been removed because people are referencing such positions, because then people will simply find other ways to mention it (through the pm system, perhaps) without it being seen by us.

Such topics are no more then an attempt at recruiting users for other forums, with the lure tactic being to offer them some sort of position with power.

If it was a real topic for development then it would undoubtedly have some sort of reverence to subversion. The creator would also be someone that is known in the community, instead of someone who has shown up the day before. Little, if any, emphasis would be on an external forum, simply because subversion and msn or IRC would be the home of the source and developers respectively.

But not all of them are. Another thing, locking topics that do not directly break the rules is an act of power abuse. I do not care what excuse the moderator who locked it gives, but they are still power abusing unless a rule against the topic previously exist. It’s no secret that those development team topics are usually used to get people to go to www.shittysubdomainhere.smfforfree.com.
